Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ceratotoxin A (CtxA, natural AMPs; insects, fly, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBMm; UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: female reproductive accessory glands, medfly,Ceratitis capitata

Literature Information.Literature: Function:  thought to protect the eggs of the insect against harmful microorganisms.Activity: Ctx A was active against Gram-negative E. coli (Marri et al., 1996).Structure:  2D NMR studies in methnaol revealed helical structure for residues 8-25 (Ragona L et al. 1996 Biopolymers 39: 653-64).Toxicity:  more peptide is needed for hemolysis. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Marchini D., Giordano PC., Amons R., Bernini LF., Dallai R.1993
Literature Information.Title: Purification and primary structure of ceratotoxin A and B, two antibacterial peptides from the female reproductive accessory glands of the medfly Ceratitis capitata (Insecta:Diptera).
